definition: to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
duty/responsibility/to reproach/to blame
responsible and diligent (idiom)

sentences.english: A. I feel we're responsible for our brothers and sisters.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，我们应该对我们的兄弟姐妹尽责。

sentences.english: Due diligence, the success rate of my near-perfect piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 尽职尽责中，成就了我一幅幅近乎完美的作品。

sentences.english: She still remained bound to a child she should not be bearing.
sentences.chinese: 她仍在对一个本来她不应该负责的孩子尽责任。

sentences.english: National courts operate inside established systems of law-enforcement.
sentences.chinese: 国家法庭在依法执行的体系内尽责。

sentences.english: If you do your duty to others， you are considered reliable.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向他人尽责，你就被认为是可信赖的。

sentences.english: The marshal is very responsible, and always waters the horses at Tian River.
sentences.chinese: 弼马温尽责尽职，经常到天河去饮马。

sentences.english: The recipe recipient transiently made the conscientious alien client unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 处方容器片刻使尽责的外国顾客不省人事。

sentences.english: They scrutinise unusual items and bring a proprietor's conscientious attitude to bear.
sentences.chinese: 他们会详查异常项目，采取所有者的尽责态度。

sentences.english: It turns out, though, that he was a conscientious helpmate.
sentences.chinese: 尽管人们证明他是一个认真尽责的帮手。

sentences.english: A good housewife should keep her house spic -and-span.
sentences.chinese: 一位尽责的家庭主妇总是把家收拾得干干净净的。

sentences.english: Building a safe campus, is the responsibility of all of us.
sentences.chinese: 构建平安校园，是我们大家的应尽责任。

sentences.english: Very few politicians are doing their duty towards the country.
sentences.chinese: 能够对本国尽职尽责的政治家实在不多。

sentences.english: The conscientious efforts of both sides during the past two years have been dedicated to the full and smooth implementation of the Joint Declaration.
sentences.chinese: 同时在过去的两年里各国都尽职尽责的执行联合宣言。

sentences.english: I've had it easy, served up on all life's silver platters like a satrap.
sentences.chinese: 我已经很易于像总督一样为人们的温饱尽职尽责。

sentences.english: Due diligence work classes, students can play in the play a leading role.
sentences.chinese: 班级工作尽心尽责，在同学中能起到表率作用。

definition: to discharge one's duties/conscientious
responsible and diligent (idiom)
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
with all of one's heart
vocation/duty/mission in life
duty/responsibility/post
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
well qualified/competent/to be equal to the task/able to do sth very well
duty to defend the country (idiom)
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to take responsibility/to bear responsibility/to be responsible
to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
to fulfill (one's duty etc)
diligence/diligent/industrious
breach of responsibility/failure to carry out one's duty
